creator: sangjin@kut.ac.kr
text:
Environment: RedHat Linux 9

I have installed Apache 2.0.48 and PHP4.3.5. I am running this web for my 
courses I teach. In our local school network, some PCs can retrieve documents 
from my server without any problem, but most of the PCs can only retrieve the 
upper portion of the document. It hangs showing only few lines of html 
document. Most PCs outside the school network do not show this problem, 
although there has been a few who have reported similar complaints.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
What type of document is this?

static content?

try "EnableSendfile off" in your

<Directory />
</Directory>

container and report back on whether or not that helped.

If PHP-generated, we probably can't debug that here.

creator: vegard7@chello.no
text:
Had a similar issue on a 567 MB file (not for other files, though). Using 
Gentoo EBuild of Apache 2.0.49-r1. Kernel 2.6.1 on an XFS filesystem. 
'EnableSendFile off ' solved the issue for me.
I am thinking this is a possible dup of Bug #18719
creator: chip@force-elite.com
nick@webthing.com
text: Insufficient information, and no reply to Jeff's question.  Works for most of us.
